reviews.sentence: Beautiful but loud. The Dupont Circle Hotel is a very nice and comfortable place to stay. Coming into the hotel however feels more like a night club than a respite from travels. There is a bar restaurant downstairs which gets very crowded very loud very quickly. On some nights they also have bands playing in the hotel. When I called the front desk at 2 am one night to let them know that there was yelling outside my window they informed me that I was wrong and that it was quiet. It was not clear to me if the noise was coming from the bar or people who were leaving the bar but it was loud enough to wake me in the middle of the night. The noise also continued for quite a period of time. Overall the hotel staff were friendly though it seems shortsighted to tell a customer they are wrong at 2 am if they are calling for assistance. If you like a vibrant scene when you are traveling stay here. If you are like me and want to find calm when you are on the road between business find somewhere else.

No breakfast included and a Huge parade that blocked our entrance to the Hotel for over three hours. Bed was comfortable staff was both pleasant and helpful. Not being able to cross street during parade. Management should not only have warned us but included instructions how to come in back way and or via subway. Had to wait it out for over three hours a lot of crazy people everywhere.

What a great Clean hotel. we went in April of 2016 and had a wonderful time. The hotel was very hospitable and accommodating. The staff was exceptional. The room was very clean and my favorite part was the heated bathroom floor i could not get enough of that. The room was a little small but we were not there often enough for that to bother us. They did not offer coffee or tea in the room. that was a little disappointing but not life changing. there are so many wonderful restaurants in the area that grabbing some coffee in the morning was not a big deal. Due be aware that they do put an extra charge on your card that get given back to you at the end of your stay. but the website does not tell you that when booking. I had a great time the staff was wonderful and the room was so clean. I would go back anytime.

Exceptional. Great Location. All major attractions are 20 30 minutes walk away. Extremely courteous and efficient staff. Very comfortable and spacious rooms with plenty of light. Plenty of eating options near by including a joint that serves authentic Spanish cuisine. The deserts at the Cafe Dupont are to die for. We were there for one night wish we could extend it by another day. Will surely be back again.

A good but expensive stay. This was a full service four star hotel with excellent acomodations and service. Air conditioning was excellent. As was the bedding. Prices in the restaurant at breakfast were too expensive.

If you go to DC stay here. Our room was a little small but we did not come to DC to spend time in the room. The bathroom was splendid so up to date the room was always spotless when we returned to it each day. So clean. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Even the bar staff where e spent a little time each evening went the extra mile for us. Thank you Dupont Circle Hotel for helping our trip to our capital spectacular.

Honeymoon in DC. LOVED THIS HOTELBoked on hotwire in ofseason so very reasonable. Front desk staff attentive thorough and small detail oriented offered complimentary water bottles on checkin newspaper delivery every morning to the room Room The small touches make the biggest diference4th floor overlooking dupont circle nespreso maker in room used every day and they refilled on request. nice considering a stands drop coffee in DC is 4 i has called and let them know was our honeymoon so maybe they upgraded us as we know other king rooms did n’t have coffee makers. also a full size chilled bottle of champagne and card was waiting on arrival for our honeymoon. i did n’t bring makeup remover called from desk with various requests and they were prompt in sending someone up mini fridge towels make up remover more nespreso and followed up withphone call to ensured had received. Food no breakfast included but plenty of places around for breakfast lunch. had the dupont cafe in hotel one morning and while good was pricey. right outside of hotel Kramer ’s books offers a 5 dollar mimosa beunch so we wish we ’d have tried that. DUPONT BAR in the hotel on the other hand was well worth every penny for the vibe food quality and service and was not unreasonablely priced at all. This is an area locals flock to as well so the club bar like atmosphere was perfect to relax in with a cocktail after a travel day. we ate here 23 nights hapilytons of cabbies out front and we used uber towouldn’t walk from here to monuments. subway right outside it just take a 6 dollar uber. would love to come back.

Exceptional. Staff was AMAZING. Held doors for us always friendly and with a smile. No pool or snack market for the kids. There were also no TV ’s to watch the Stanley Cup playoffs in the bar areathey were renovating it.

Great Service Mostly Great Room. So overall this hotel was exactly what we needed. Centralized right near the metro tons of restaurant options and things to do and even walk able to the white house mall area about a mile. Full disclosure we were trying to be fancy on a budget. we have done this before with other places and we usually get a small room that is close to the elevator. We just did not realize how small this room would be. There was no wall of a bathroom only a frosted glass wall with a door separating the toilet shower from the rest of the room. The AC was full blast but it was still much cooler in the hallway. We eventually got used to it once we were in the room. We also asked them several times and in the notes section of the reservation to do something cute as we were visiting for our 1 year anniversary and nobody noticed said anything or did anything. We chose this hotel as part of the Doyle Collection but it was definitely not the caliber of some of their other hotels but still niceOkay now the good. I loved the lotion shampoos. they are gingery and delicious. The bathrobes were great and the bed was SUPER comfy and huge. I might have preferred a queen bed for more floor space in a room that small but regardless it was incredibly comfy. They also provided good customer service. We went to a dinner the night before we left and were able to leave out leftovers a TON of fod I am not wasting that. with the front desk between checkout and heading home. There also was not a refrigerator in the room besides the one with the drinks stocked that you can pay for and when we called to ask about our food after dinner when we got home they literally brought a mini fridge up to us on a dolly and sort of left it in the middle of the rom a little strange but it worked. Everyone was really kind to us the doormen were great. We did not use the concierge but they did have one. The one other thing that was a little funky. My husband booked through their website and they have different deals and such. He got the summertime package or something like that and when we checked in AND checked out they did not include the perks until we asked free drink tickets and free valet parking. This was only a little frustrating because even if I am in the smallest room I do not want to feel like I walked into a fancy hotel and feel like I am price gauging I want to do that in the privacy of my own home D. Overall it was a nice stay but I think I had just as well stay at the Hilton up the street and use a Groupon. BUT if you want to be right in the middle of it all in Dupont Circle this is a very solid option.

A great place to stay. We could not fault the hotel or it ’s staff in any way. The welcome at. The door set the tone for the entire visit. The room was spacious and clean. The bed and pillows exceptionally comfortable. The room was warm. Breakfast was a buffet style and the crispy bacon to my taste but maybe not for everyone. However I loved it. Staff were very attentive. The reception staff were excellent and special mention must go to Magdalena who booked our train tickets for the next part of our journey and printed off the booking for us. A VERY BIG THANKYOU TO ALTHE STAFF for making our stay so pleasant. We will definitely be recommending the DuPont Circle to others. The stay was excellent value.

Pembroke Restaurant Waiter Derrick Borlie. Waiter Derrick Borlie provided outstanding friendly and efficient service. He checked frequently to ensure my friends and my water glasses and coffees were filled. He also provided our check and processed our payments timely. He has a very nice manners and is a gentleman. I live in DuPont Circle and frequently go to this restaurant for Sunday brunch. I would be very happy if Derrick is our waiter again. Mike Allen.

Amazing. Everyone at the hotel was super nice and cordial. The hotel itself is conveniently located and has beautiful rooms lobby restaurant and bar. I will compare all future hotel stays to this experience. It ’s definitley a hotel that I would recommend and come back to in the future. Top notch.

Of course the location is perfect. Ample taxis close to the Metro. Interesting shopping and dining in every direction. Nice coffee bar — a step up from Starbucks. Though Starbucks is right down the street too. Very attentive though not fawning staff. For me the lobby art and design was exceptional.

Great Trip. I loved getting to stay at the Dupont Circle Hotel. Amazing location easy walk to the metro station to get around the city. The room was amazing and the heated floors in the bathroom were a nice surprise. The Doyle Bar was also spectacular the staff was wonderful and a bartender named Harper was very personable and made delicious drinks for my family. He recommended the truffle fries which were so delicious. All around amazing experience I would definitely come back.

Excellent location and modern clean room. The room was clean modern with good functional fittings. There were plenty of restaurants to choose from nearby of different styles and pricing. The Metro was just across the road and Downtown shopping was about 10 minutes walk. We found the staff friendly and helpful.
The rooms were nice and clean and the staff was very helpful. We also liked the restaurant and bar on property.

3 Nights at The Dupont Circle. We loved our experience at the Dupont Circle in late July. Great location fabulous rooms food and bar and all services were top notch. Special shout out to Adam Daniel Calvin and Bety for the exceptional service at that fabulous bar overlooking the circle. They took phenomenal care of us. We will certainly come back.

Stylish luxurious friendly and conviently located. Its beautiful rooms stylish bar excellent restaurant friendly staff and convenient location within walking distance from the world famous Philips collection and steps away from a Metro stop that leads to all other major sites have made this our longtime first choice in DC.

My Favorite Choice In DC. I absolutely LOVE this hotel. Although you are right in Dupont Circle you would never know once you step inside. The hotel feels like home and the service is exceptional. I loved the bar and restaurant and the beds was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. I just wish this hotel was in every city.
